databases.name: MySQL
databases.description: An open-source relational database management system that enables efficient storage and retrieval of data.

databases.name: MariaDB
databases.description: A community-driven open-source fork of MySQL with enhanced features and performance improvements.

databases.name: TiDB
databases.description: A distributed SQL database that supports both SQL and NoSQL workloads with horizontal scalability and fault tolerance.

databases.name: Redis
databases.description: An in-memory data structure store often used as a database, cache, and message broker.

databases.name: MongoDB
databases.description: A NoSQL document database that stores data in flexible, JSON-like documents.

databases.name: Elastic Search
databases.description: A distributed, RESTful search and analytics engine capable of handling large volumes of data.

databases.name: Firebase
databases.description: A platform that offers backend services, including a real-time database, authentication, cloud messaging, and more, for mobile and web applications.

databases.name: Supabase DB
databases.description: An open-source alternative to Firebase that offers real-time database, authentication, and storage services.

databases.name: Clickhouse
databases.description: An open-source column-oriented database management system designed for online analytical processing (OLAP) workloads.

databases.name: Snowflake
databases.description: A cloud-based data warehousing platform designed for large-scale data storage and analysis.

databases.name: Amazon DynamoDB
databases.description: A fully managed NoSQL database service that offers high performance, scalability, and reliability.

databases.name: PostgreSQL
databases.description: An advanced open-source relational database management system known for its stability and reliability.
